title: What Happened to Champion Lore
body:
Something I enjoyed doing when I first started playing in 2009, is reading the lore of each champion. I started to notice as newer champions were released that Riot was making the lore shorter. It didn't bother me too much because it isn't a big gameplay feature. Although after looking over Amumu's lore, I found that he had been reduced and altered into something that doesn't really explain anything significant about him.

I'm wondering why Riot continues to include a Lore section if they have no interest in developing the Lore behind champions.

For those who enjoy the lore, it's a disappointment. For those with no interest in the lore, it doesn't affect them. So why continue to disappoint the people who read the lore when it could just be removed.

In summary, I feel that including a lore section is unnecessary if they do not want to write quality lore.

replies.body: Extended lore is usually on the website now.

I didn't realise that. Thank you for that.

Edit: After looking at the lore on the website, it's the same 3 sentence lore that they use in the client.

As you now, Riot decided awhile ago to revamp pretty much all their lores (Which is why we are learning about all this targon, shadow isles and shurima stuff).

Champions with shortened lores usually either have their complete lore elsewhere (The Shurima lore explains Cassiopeia's, Sivir's Azir's etc. and Amumu's lore is explained in his music video for maximum impact) or maybe an event is planned for them and their full story will be revealed along with the event (Targon lores, Shadow Isles lores).

I expect them to make most of the lores the standard of Diana's for example, but this will take SOO LONG.

Amumu's lore was shortened in the Shurima update with Azir's release.
Shuriman lore was covered in two part video for Cassiopea, Nasus, Renekton, Xerath, Azir and Sivir.
Amumu's lore is explained by the sad mummy music video.

Riot is explaining the lore better now than previously, and expanding upon it in different ways.
Take a look at the Mount Targon update to the lore which is currently going on, cleaning up Pantheon, Leona and Diana, while also adding in Aurelion Sol and Taric's rework.

The Bilgewater update also refreshed a lot of old Lore and gave Illaoi's lore.

Yeah, I think they need to work harder on it. They should also consider the items' lore before changing them. For example the magic damage on-hit from Wits End was changed from 42 to 40..... as if that will make a big difference in the game, but it sure makes a difference to the lore.
